components.name: Sol
components.description: Our home star, a middle-aged yellow dwarf that has been shining for 4.6 billion years. It makes up 99.86% of the Solar System's mass and provides the energy that sustains life on Earth. Sol is currently in the main sequence phase of its life cycle and will continue fusing hydrogen for another 5 billion years before evolving into a red giant.
